title: Text face?
content:
Can anyone recommend a companion text face for Village’s “Crank 8” [http://www.vllg.com/Lux/Crank8/mudTyper+Weights/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080422064655/http:/www.vllg.com/Lux/Crank8/mudTyper+Weights/)

Works well for display but a little too irregular for copy.

Thanks!

 [‹ Spotted any good organic food fonts?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080422064655/http:/www.typophile.com/node/17373 "Go to previous forum topic") [Brochure design ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080422064655/http:/www.typophile.com/node/39120 "Go to next forum topic")
author: snaffler_b

comments.content:
Assuming you want a similar flavor as opposed to contrast:  
 [FF DIN](http://web.archive.org/web/20080422064655/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_din_ot/)  
 [Flama](http://web.archive.org/web/20080422064655/http:/vllg.com/Feliciano/Flama/mudTyper+Weights/)  
 [Stalemate](http://web.archive.org/web/20080422064655/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/psyops/sophisto_superset_ot/)  
 [Reykjavik](http://web.archive.org/web/20080422064655/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/psyops/reykjavik_sans_superset_ot/)  
 [FF Unit](http://web.archive.org/web/20080422064655/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=Unit%20OT)  
 [Ubik](http://web.archive.org/web/20080422064655/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/presence_typo/ubik/)
I might go for something complementary, like a serif, rather than as similar as Din. What’s it for?

Thanks for the replies... planning to use Crank8 for a logotype and as a headline font for a non-profit.

The font I choose for copy would probably be used in print material only (brochures, flyers etc.). Legibility is a key concern. Was thinking of something like Excelsior or Garamond, but perhaps too traditional (needs to be forward thinking, “innovative” brand).

When you mention Garamond, being a humanistic typeface, as well as looking for something that should be more “innovative” I can’t help but to think of my own typeface: [FF Profile](http://web.archive.org/web/20080422064655/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=Profile&site=d&btnG=Go). A sans serif text face that has it’s roots in the renaissance but with a minimum of contrast. Maybe this could be a healthy contrast to the more geometric Crank8.

Martin
Thanks Martin. I’ll certainly consider it...
